 Hi,

     Yes I want to test the jdbc. I am using the hibernate connection pool for the database connectivity. In Tomcat i set the jndi name and now i want to get the connection in my test cases.
      Now I am testing the input data which I am sending. Is it correct way or else I have to do anything more.
      Please clarify these 2 things.

 Thanks & Regards,
 Thanuja.


Lasse Koskela <lasse.koskela@...> wrote:          Hi,

On 5/17/07, p_thanuja82 <p_thanuja82@...> wrote:
> I am new to junit test cases.We have to test all the classes and
> method.It's enough to test the db connection,the class which we are
> passing the input data.
>
> Plz clarify my doubt.

Let's first clarify what you're saying above. Am I interpreting you
correctly that you're _asking_ whether it's enough to test the
database connection and some class you are passing input data to?

If yes, then I've got a couple of follow-up questions:

- When you say you "have to test all the classes and methods", doesn't
that kind of dictate that "just" testing the database connection and
some other class is by definition not enough?

- When you say, "test the database connection", what exactly do you
mean? What would the unit be that you're testing? A class that talks
to the database over JDBC?

Lasse
